title: Aubrey Plaza is sheer daring in see-through top over lacy bra at LA premiere of Jojo Rabbit
text:
In the upcoming film Jojo Rabbit, Taika Waititi plays a young boy's imaginary friend Adolf Hitler.

A star-studded lineup showed out Tuesday for the movie's premiere at Post 43 in Los Angeles.

Aubrey Plaza showed some skin as she put on a daring display in a sexy chic black ensemble.

Sexy chic: Aubrey Plaza showed some skin as she put on a daring display in a sexy chic black ensemble Tuesday at the Jojo Rabbit premiere in Los Angeles

She sported a long-sleeve button-down sheer jeweled black top with lapels and shoulder pads.

It also featured a black button panel down the middle and long cuffs at the end of the billowy sleeves.

The risque see-through blouse revealed a sexy black bra trimmed in lace underneath.

She wore the top tucked into a matching pair of pleated billowy high-waisted black slacks.

Sheer top: She sported a long-sleeve button-down sheer jeweled black top with lapels and shoulder pads

Billowy sleeves: It also featured a black button panel down the middle and long cuffs at the end of the billowy sleeves

Black lace bra: The risque see-through blouse revealed a sexy black bra trimmed in lace underneath

High-waisted: She wore the top tucked into a matching pair of pleated billowy high-waisted black slacks

Plaza completed the look with a pair of black patent leather pumps, as she hit the red carpet.

She accessorized with a pair of petite diamond hoop earrings with matching rings, showing off her red manicure.

Plaza recently joined Jimmy Kimmel, Sarah Silverman and Tiffany Haddish in Comedy Central's Crank Yankers reboot.

She's also working on a Netflix romantic comedy entitled Hope and the psychological thriller Black Bear.

This year, she starred in the horror reboot Child's Play, while reviving her role as Lenny in the third and final season of Legion.
description: Plaza recently joined the cast of Comedy Central's Crank Yankers reboot. She's also working on a Netflix romantic comedy entitled Hope and the psychological thriller Black Bear.
